newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian trade union leader shot, police say.
newsitem.headline: Indian trade union leader shot, police say.

text.p: Indian trade union leader Datta Samant was shot while travelling in a car in a Bombay suburb on Thursday, police officials said.
"He was shot but we have no details," one official said.
He said Samant, a former member of parliament, was shot at Powai, a Bombay suburb, at 11:24 a.m. (0554 GMT).
Samant shot into fame in the early 1980s as a fiery union leader who led a long-running textile strike in Bombay.
Last year he led a strike at automobile maker PAL-Peugeot Ltd.
